page.title: 06TOURISM (LAMPHEY)
page.content: The Lamphey area lies in the heart of the South Pembrokeshire tourist area. There are many caravan sites in the area as well as blocks of holiday flats in Freshwater East. Numerous farms as well as private householders offer bed and breakfast accomodation. As a result much employment in the area is geared towards this rather seasonal trade. The main attraction of the area is the very well known coastline. There are numerous safe beaches for bathing, surfing and fishing. The coastal path is famous throughout Britain. The flora and fauna of this region attract many people each year. The castles in the area such as Pembroke, Carew and Manorbier are also magnets for tourists.
